body:
Hello

Since there is quite a few commands that people are not aware of on Official Servers, I am going to post all of the current commands here, and this post will be updated whenever a new command is added.

If anybody has any suggestions on how to improve the plugin, please post them below. An official will then communicate that suggestion to Kylo or Javi if they think it would be beneficial. 


Perm

Command + Args

Brief Description

Examples

Official

/tm ref <player>

Toggle referee rank for any player.

/tm ref KyloCode

Official

/tm broadcast <message>

Broadcasts something to the whole server

/tm broadcast match starting in 5 minutes.

Ref

/tm register <team tag>

Sets an open team in the match to an Avicus tournament team.

/tm register scm

Ref

/start (time)

Force match to start.

/start 10

Ref

/end

Force end of match.

/end

Ref

/cycle (time)

Cycle to next match.

/cycle 10

Ref

/setnext <map>

Set next map in rotation.

/sn Enoki

Ref

/tm ready <team tag>

Once a team is ready to play, a ref types this for them. The match starts after all teams are ready. This toggles ready status.

/tm ready scm


(type again to unready)

Ref

/rc <message>

Puts a message in referee chat that

/rc Match on Official01 between x and y has started.

All

/team

/t

Toggle team chat.

/t


All

/report -t <player> <reason>

Report players to refs, advisors and officials with the flag

/report -t KyloCode <reason here>

title: The Tournament Plugin

replies.body: lol, i still have all of the official files from when i was ref.
replies.body_tagged: lol, i still have all of the official files from when i was ref.

replies.body: They should add /time set or just turn daylight cycle off
replies.body_tagged: They should add /time set or just turn daylight cycle off

replies.body: I think a scoreboard/seperate stats page just for tournament matches would be pretty cool. A game-by-game analysis as well. Probably going to have to be custom-made though, but it would bring more competition to thesr games.
replies.body_tagged: I think a scoreboard/seperate stats page just for tournament matches would be pretty cool. A game-by-game analysis as well. Probably going to have to be custom-made though, but it would bring more competition to thesr games.

replies.body:
1. For some games play by play would be so boring.

eg a TNT map where I sit there and be like "oh look, anther cannon shot and it goes into the water and does nothing." Or when cacal plays TDM

but there are some maps, CTW in particular where this would be really cool
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body: Idk why i thought the plugin was released
replies.body_tagged: Idk why i thought the plugin was released

replies.body: T1 apparently - I dug up old Official documents and found it all
replies.body_tagged: T1 apparently - I dug up old Official documents and found it all

replies.body:
/report -t doesn't work, all it does is adding -t to the reason


Also normal players just have permissions for /t or /team.
Refs and Officials should be aware what commands they can use, since there is a document for this. (Well, this post is the document, it just got copied from it.)

replies.body:
All these commands, except /team that works on public servers as well, work only of Official servers.
But since /report -t doesn't work normal players can't do anything with the information in the OP.

reply_to.body: I think you have to do it on a tournament/official server?

replies.body: Yes - you see it because you're a referee. It has been tested and the -t is either meant to be there or it's a glitch.
